comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Sári Petráss (1888 – September 9, 1930 at Antwerp) was a Hungarian operetta actress and singer. In the 1910s and 1920s, she played leading soprano parts in Budapest, Vienna, London and on Broadway." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S%C3%A1ri_Petr%C3%A1ss

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: ibdb.com/person.php?id=56039 shows that she was on Broadway from Sept 1916 to April 1917 in Little Miss Springtime.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: A number of papers reported (obviously erroneously) in February, 1916 that she had been executed as a spy: "ACTRESS SHOT AS A SPY CLEVELAND, Feb. 15—Sari Petrass, Hungarian actress, has been executed as a spy. She was noted over the continent as a beauty. Hungarians of this city just received word that she was caught obtaining information from Austrian officers and sending it to England." chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn88085187/1916-02-15/ed-...
